Sequence Information.Peptide Name: ABP-118 (chain a: Abp118alpha, Gly-rich;  natural AMPs; two-chain class 2b bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes. For chain b: Abp118beta, see Info; UCLL2a)
Sequence Information.Source: Lactobacillus salivariussubsp. salivarius UCC118;  human microbiota:gut, symbiont bacteria

Literature Information.Literature: A two chain bacteriocin. Shown is the sequence for chain a. The peptide sequence for chain b is KNGYGGSGNRWVHCGAGIVGGALIGAIGGPWSAVAGGISGGFTSCR. Animal model:mouse: It has been demonstrated that the production of this peptide by a probiotic strain Lactobacillus salivarius UCC118 (of human origin), administered into mice, can significantly protect mice against infection with the invasive foodborne pathogen Listeria monocytogenes (Corr SC et al 2007 PNAS 104:7617-21).
Literature Information.Author: Flynn S, van Sinderen D, Thornton GM, Holo H, Nes IF, Collins JK.2002
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of the genetic locus responsible for the production of ABP-118, a novel bacteriocin produced by the probiotic bacterium Lactobacillus salivarius subsp. salivarius UCC118.
